snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter met with Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi and Khaled al-Obeidi, the Iraqi defense minister, to discuss steps to speed up the fight against the Islamic State.
abstract: Iraqi authorities rebuff Pentagon's offer of increased support ahead of campaign to retake city of Mosul from Islamic State; Obama administration's need to show broader and more decisive action against militant group conflicts with Iraq's predominantly Shiite leaders' desire to minimize American presence in deference to its ally Iran.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter met with Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi and Khaled al-Obeidi, the Iraqi defense minister, to discuss steps to speed up the fight against the Islamic State.
